cyclone.name: IDA
cyclone.current_location: about 510 miles SE of New Orleans, Louisiana
cyclone.trajectory: tracking northwest across the Gulf of Mexico toward the southeast Louisiana coast
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: southeast Louisiana (between Intracoastal City and the Mouth of the Mississippi River, near the New Orleans metro area)

weather_observation.under_warning: Hurricane Warning and Storm Surge Warning
weather_observation.watch_coast: No active watch segment at the port; watches are farther west (Cameron to west of Intracoastal City LA) and east (Mouth of Pearl River to MS/AL border).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Intracoastal City LA to the Mouth of the Pearl River, including Lake Pontchartrain, Lake Maurepas, and Metropolitan New Orleans (Hurricane Warning). Storm surge warning from east of Rockefeller Wildlife Refuge LA to the MS/AL border, including Vermilion Bay and the tidal lakes.
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire southeast Louisiana coastline, especially Morgan City to Ocean Springs MS, including the Mississippi River Delta and surrounding tidal lakes.
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force winds (potentially 110–130 mph if Ida reaches major-hurricane strength) are likely at the port beginning Sunday evening, with tropical-storm winds arriving by early Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Life-threatening storm surge of 7–11 ft possible at the Mississippi River Delta and 10–15 ft westward toward Morgan City; surrounding tidal lakes 4–7 ft.
weather_observation.rainfall: Extremely heavy rainfall of 8–16 inches with isolated 20 inches expected across southeast Louisiana, producing significant flash and river flooding.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Tornado threat Sunday–Monday, dangerous surf and rip currents, prolonged power outages, and potential levee overtopping outside federal protection system.
